frontMatter.description:
The database secrets engine allows new functionality to be added through a
plugin interface without needing to modify vault's core code. This allows you
write your own code to generate credentials in any database you wish. It also
allows databases that require dynamically linked libraries to be used as
plugins while keeping Vault itself statically linked.

`,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},"Init")," was taking (",mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},"config")," and ",mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},"verifyConnection"),") are now wrapped into ",mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},"InitializeRequest"),`.
The returned `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},"map[string]interface{}")," object is now wrapped into ",mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},"InitializeResponse"),`.
Only `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},"Initialize")," is needed to adhere to the ",mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},"Database")," interface."),mdx("li",e({parentName:"ol"},{className:"g-type-long-body"}),"Update ",mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},"CreateUser")," to ",mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},"NewUser"),". The ",mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},"NewUserRequest"),` object contains the username and
password of the user to be created. It also includes a list of statements for creating the
user as well as several other fields that may or may not be applicable. Your custom plugin
